alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 8:50AM EST until January 14 at 7:31AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River near Stony Creek. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Jarratt boat ramp, approximately 5 miles upstream, has water completely covering the concrete boat launch area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Saturday was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 01/22/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 900 PM EST.
